DataElement.preferredName: Positron Emission Tomography Scan Procedure Directionality Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response that indicates the direction of the PET scan.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Positron Emission Tomography Scan Procedure Directionality
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered._The data or image obtained by gathering information with a sensing device._A qualifier for the direction on the body the procedure is performed.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A noninvasive imaging method that provides information about cellular activity (metabolic information).  It is used along with magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) which provides information about the shape and size of the tumor (spatial information).

Concepts.definition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.

Property.preferredDefinition: The data or image obtained by gathering information with a sensing device.:A qualifier for the direction on the body the procedure is performed.

Concepts.definition: The data or image obtained by gathering information with a sensing device.
A qualifier for the direction on the body the procedure is performed.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Denoting the back surface of the body; at or near the hind end in quadrupeds or toward the spine in primates.

Concepts.definition: Denoting the back surface of the body; at or near the hind end in quadrupeds or toward the spine in primates.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Denoting the front surface of the body; often used to indicate the position of one structure relative to another.
